title: Can You See Who Watched Your Instagram Reels?

steps.title: The short answer is no.
steps.content: The short answer is no. What you can do instead is guess who saw your video by looking at the Reel's comments and likes. To see how many people watched and interacted your Reel, find your Reel and tap the number under the heart icon on the right side of your screen. Here you'll see how many times the reel was viewed, how many likes it received, and a list of comments.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. It's in the bottom right corner of the screen. You'll need a Business or Creator account to use Insights. If you have a personal account, you can switch to a Professional account . [3] X Research source To switch your account type, tap the three-line menu icon, and tap Settings > Account > Switch to Professional/Creator Account . If you decide you don't want to keep using a Business or Creator account, you can always switch back to Personal .

steps.title: Tap the Reel tab on your profile.
steps.content: Tap the Reel tab on your profile. It looks like a director's clapboard with a play icon in the middle and will display all your reels.

steps.title: Tap the Reel you want to see Insights for.
steps.content: Tap the Reel you want to see Insights for. The video will begin playing in a new window.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . This three-dot menu icon is at the bottom of your video and will prompt a menu to open.

steps.title: Tap View Insights.
steps.content: Tap View Insights . You'll be able to see how many accounts you've reached, how many accounts you've engaged, and other stats, such as that video's likes, comments, and shares . [4] X Research source

steps.title: No.
steps.content: No. When you make a Reel , it reflects the privacy settings of your account. For example, if you have a private account, your Reels will be private. [5] X Research source
